metadata.title: CVE-2019-18346 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A CSRF issue was discovered in DAViCal through 1.1.8. If an authenticateduser visits an attacker-controlled webpage, the attacker can send arbitraryrequests in the name of the user to the application. If the attacked useris an administrator, the attacker could for example add a new admin user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18346` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

davical - 1.1.9.2-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: davical package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.1.9.2-1').
